problem.markdown:
>>Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Converts:<< ( ) Mechanical to Chemical Energy ( ) Mechanical to Heat Energy (x) Chemical to Electrical Energy ( ) Chemical to Heat Energy
>>An oxygen vacancy can be created in ZrO2 by adding:<< (x) A trivalent cation ( ) A tetravalent cation ( ) A pentavalent cation ( ) A bivalent anion
>>In a solid oxide fuel cell, the oxygen ion diffuses from:<< ( ) Anode to Electrolyte ( ) Anode to Cathode ( ) Cathode to Electrolyte (x) Cathode to Anode
>>In a solid oxide fuel cell, the hydrogen ion diffuses from:<< ( ) Anode to Electrolyte (x) Anode to Cathode ( ) Cathode to Electrolyte ( ) Cathode to Anode
>>Total resistance of grain, grain boundary and electrode in a solid oxide fuel cell is calculated by:<< ( ) Ionic conductance (x) Fitting experimental EIS data to a model ( ) Using Ohms Law ( ) Current drawn by the SOFC
>>In the Nyquist plot, a pure resistor (of resistance R) will appear as a:<< (x) Point at R on x-axis ( ) Line above R from x-axis ( ) Line above R from y-axis ( ) Curve of Radius R
>>In the Nyquist plot, a pure capacitor will appear as a:<< ( ) Point at R on x-axis ( ) Point at R on y-axis ( ) Line above R in x-axis (x) Line above R in y-axis
>>In the Bode plot, a pure resistor (or resistance R) will appear as a:<< ( ) Point at Resistance R (x) Line of slope zero ( ) Curve of radius R ( ) Surface with center at R
>>In the Bode plot, a pure capacitor (or Capacitance C) will appear as a:<< ( ) Point at Resistance R ( ) Line of slope zero ( ) Line of slope +1 (x) Line of slope -1
>>Solid Oxide Fuel Cell essentially requires:<< ( ) Porous ionic conducting electrolyte ( ) Porous electronic conducting electrolyte (x) Dense ionic conducting electrolyte ( ) Dense electronic conducting electrolyte
